0625/33  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 265, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Theory (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 300, 904, 316]]<|/det|>
May/June 2021  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 325, 904, 341]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 395, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 383, 359, 399]]<|/det|>
No additional materials are needed.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 808, 574]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units.- Take the weight of \(1.0 \text{kg}\) to be \(10 \text{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10 \text{m/s}^2\)).  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 603, 220, 618]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 619, 728, 651]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 96, 90]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 91]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 813, 91]]<|/det|> Fig. 9.1 shows two uncharged balloons suspended from a beam by light thread. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[291, 97, 705, 297]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 310, 534, 329]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 342, 601, 361]]<|/det|> The balloons are close to each other but not touching. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 373, 897, 392]]<|/det|> In the box below, draw the position of the balloons when they both have a positive charge. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[291, 400, 705, 599]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 599, 920, 616]]<|/det|> [1] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 630, 146, 648]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 630, 457, 648]]<|/det|> Table 9.1 includes a list of materials. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 660, 803, 678]]<|/det|> State whether each material is an electrical conductor or an electrical insulator. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 692, 433, 710]]<|/det|> The first example is done for you. <|ref|>table_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[457, 723, 541, 740]]<|/det|> Table 9.1 <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 749, 752, 902]]<|/det|>
